definition: to save/to economize/to do without/to omit/to leave out/province/(archaic) central government department
to inspect/to examine/to be aware/to pay a visit (to one's parents or elders)
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

sentences.english: To save energy I kept the flashlight off.
sentences.chinese: 为了省电我关了手电筒。

sentences.english: In addition, the prosthetic hand has the feature of auto power-off to save the energy.
sentences.chinese: 此外并具有自动断电机制，可达到节能省电之目标。

sentences.english: The light of the firefly does not produce heat.
sentences.chinese: 萤光灯较白炽灯省电且发热少。

sentences.english: Speed cooking, saving time and electricity. Enhancing your lifestyle.
sentences.chinese: 快速煮食，省时省电，为平凡的生活添写意。

definition: quantity of electric charge or current
to wait for an opportunity/(electronic devices) standby
air conditioning/air conditioner (including units that have a heating mode)/CL:臺|台[tai2]
